```{python}
#| label: fig-crystal-oscillator
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "Circuit diagram of a single-ended Pierce crystal oscillator operating the quartz between series and parallel resonance where it acts as a large high-Q inductor. Note that the quartz crystal has no dc path, hence we need a high-ohmic bias resistor to connect M1 into a diode configuration." 
import schemdraw as sd
import schemdraw.elements as elm
import schemdraw.dsp as dsp

sd.svgconfig.svg2 = False

with sd.Drawing(canvas='svg') as d:
    d.config(unit=2, fontsize=14)

    M1 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).label('$M_1$', loc='right').reverse().anchor('source').drop('gate').theta(0)
    l1 = elm.Line().up(d.unit/2).dot().at(M1.drain)
    l3 = elm.Line().down(d.unit/4).at(M1.source)
    elm.Ground()
    l4 = elm.Line().left(d.unit*3/4).dot().at(M1.gate)
    elm.Line().up().toy(l1.end)
    Rb = elm.Resistor().right().to(l1.end).label(r'$R_\mathrm{bias} \gg$')

    l2 = elm.Line().up(d.unit*3/4).dot().at(l1.end)
    elm.SourceI().up().label(r'$I_\mathrm{bias}$').reverse()
    elm.Vdd().label(r'$V_\mathrm{DD}$')

    elm.Line().right(d.unit).at(l2.end).dot()
    d.push()
    elm.Line().right(d.unit/2).dot(open=True).label(r'$V_\mathrm{out}$', loc='right')
    d.pop()
    C2 = elm.Capacitor().down().toy(l3.end).label(r'$C_2$')
    elm.Ground()

    elm.Line().left(d.unit*2).at(l2.end)
    elm.Crystal().down().toy(M1.gate).dot()
    d.push()
    elm.Line().right().to(l4.end)
    d.pop()
    C1 = elm.Capacitor().down().toy(l3.end).label(r'$C_1$')
    elm.Ground()
```
